Package services

Class ScheduleService

java.lang.Object
services.ScheduleService
All Implemented Interfaces:
IScheduleService
public class ScheduleService extends Object implements IScheduleService
The ScheduleService class manages the scheduling of appointments for doctors. It handles loading and saving schedules from/to a CSV file, booking appointments, and modifying the availability status of time slots.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ScheduleService()
    Constructs a ScheduleService and loads the schedule from the CSV file.

  • Method Details

    • getScheduleMap

      public Map<String,Map<LocalDate,Map<LocalTime,Schedule>>> getScheduleMap()
      Retrieves the full schedule map for all doctors.

      The schedule map is a nested structure where:

      • The outer map's key is the doctor's ID.
      • The second-level map's key is the date (LocalDate) of the schedule.
      • The innermost map's key is the time slot (LocalTime), and the value is the Schedule object.
      This structure allows access to any doctor's schedule for a specific date and time slot.
      Returns:
      A map containing the schedule for all doctors, organized by doctor ID, date, and time.

    • cancelAppointment

      public boolean cancelAppointment(String doctorID, LocalDate date, LocalTime timeSlot, String patientID)
      Description copied from interface: IScheduleService
      Cancels an appointment for a specific doctor at a specified date and time slot.
      Specified by:
      cancelAppointment in interface IScheduleService
      Parameters:

      date - The date of the appointment to cancel.
      timeSlot - The time slot of the appointment to cancel.
      patientID - The unique identifier of the patient whose appointment is being canceled.
      Returns:
      true if the appointment was successfully canceled; false otherwise.

    • setUnavailable2

      public void setUnavailable2(String doctorID, LocalDate date, LocalTime timeSlot, String patientID)
      Marks a specific time slot in the doctor's schedule as unavailable by associating it with a patient ID.

      This method updates the schedule for the given doctor, date, and time slot, setting the status to the patient ID if the time slot is marked as "Available". If the slot is already "Blocked", it will print a message indicating so. The updated schedule is saved to the storage after the change.

      Parameters:
      doctorID - The unique identifier of the doctor whose schedule is being updated.
      date - The date of the time slot to be marked as unavailable.
      timeSlot - The specific time slot to be marked as unavailable.
      patientID - The unique identifier of the patient for whom the time slot is being reserved.

    • unblockTimeSlots

      public void unblockTimeSlots(String doctorID)
      Marks specific time slots in the doctor's schedule as available for a given date and time range.

      This method updates the doctor's schedule by setting the specified time slots to "Available". It checks for existing patient appointments and skips those slots to avoid overwriting. The changes are saved after the updates.

      Parameters:
      doctorID - The unique identifier of the doctor whose schedule is being updated.

    • setAvailable

    • blockTimeSlots

      public void blockTimeSlots(String doctorID)
      Blocks time slots for a specific doctor within the specified date and time range.

      The method allows the user to specify the start and end dates as well as the time intervals for blocking slots. It validates 30-minute intervals and checks for conflicting appointments before marking the slots as unavailable.

      Parameters:
      doctorID - The unique identifier of the doctor for whom the time slots are to be blocked.
